content:
If you build it they will come PERIOD

The UT chapter of Habitat for Humanity tested this familiar phrase when it

began building its very first house last spring and come they did PERIOD More

than  UT students came out to the Knoxville building site and helped

construct a home for a family that would not have been able to own one

otherwise PERIOD

The chapter which has been on campus since  plans to build yet

another home in the spring of  PERIOD

Steve Musick adviser of the UT Habitat chapter said fundraising efforts

will begin during the fall semester as a house that takes the organization

two months to build usually takes ten months to finance PERIOD

The fundraising is expected to include a variety of activities the first

of which will be sponsored by A Communications a company that offers

paging services PERIOD

 Musick said PERIOD 

Musick said a membership drive will be held concurrently with the

fundraiser PERIOD

Paul Scott a site manager for Habitat works with the Knoxville chapter of

the international organization PERIOD He said Habitat for Humanity currently has

about  affiliated chapters in the U.S. as well as active chapters in

 foreign countries PERIOD

 Scott said PERIOD 

Several members of the UT chapter used their Spring Break last year to

travel to Florida and help rebuild homes damaged by a hurricane Scott

said PERIOD

Musick said the family that will live in the home UT Habitat will build in

the spring will help with the construction and pay for the home itself PERIOD



Musick said PERIOD 

Although most of the fundraising for construction is done at the local

level Scott said Habitat for Humanity International often makes special

deals with large companies to get building materials at a substantial

discount PERIOD Local chapters tithe to the international organization to help

fund construction in thirdworld countries PERIOD

 Scott said PERIOD 

For more information about the UT chapter of Habitat for Humanity and its

projects contact Musick at  PERIOD
